26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_mmu_gf100.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:34 riastradh Exp $");

29#include "priv.h"
30
31#include <subdev/fb.h>
32#include <subdev/ltc.h>
33#include <subdev/timer.h>

35#include <core/gpuobj.h>
36
37/* Map from compressed to corresponding uncompressed storage type.
38 * The value 0xff represents an invalid storage type.
39 */
40const u8 gf100_pte_storage_type_map[256] =
41{
42 0x00, 0x01, 0x01, 0x01, 0x01, 0x01, 0xff, 0x01, /* 0x00 */
43 0x01, 0x01, 0x01, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
44 0xff, 0x11, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x11, /* 0x10 */
45 0x11, 0x11, 0x11, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
46 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x26, 0x27, /* 0x20 */
47 0x28, 0x29, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
48 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0x30 */
49 0xff, 0xff, 0x26, 0x27, 0x28, 0x29, 0x26, 0x27,
50 0x28, 0x29, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x46, 0xff, /* 0x40 */
51 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
52 0xff, 0x46, 0x46, 0x46, 0x46, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0x50 */
53 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
54 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0x60 */
55 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
56 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0x70 */
57 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x7b, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
58 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x7b, 0x7b, /* 0x80 */
59 0x7b, 0x7b, 0xff, 0x8b, 0x8c, 0x8d, 0x8e, 0xff,
60 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0x90 */
61 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
62 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x8b, 0x8c, 0x8d, 0x8e, 0xa7, /* 0xa0 */
63 0xa8, 0xa9, 0xaa, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
64 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0xb0 */
65 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xa7,
66 0xa8, 0xa9, 0xaa, 0xc3, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0xc0 */
67 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xc3, 0xc3,
68 0xc3, 0xc3, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, /* 0xd0 */
69 0xfe, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfe,
70 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xff, /* 0xe0 */
71 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xff,
72 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, /* 0xf0 */
73 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xfd, 0xfe, 0xff
74};
75
76
77static void
78gf100_vm_map_pgt(struct nvkm_gpuobj *pgd, u32 index, struct nvkm_memory *pgt[2])
79{
80 u32 pde[2] = { 0, 0 };
81
82 if (pgt[0])
83 pde[1] = 0x00000001 | (nvkm_memory_addr(pgt[0]) >> 8);
84 if (pgt[1])
85 pde[0] = 0x00000001 | (nvkm_memory_addr(pgt[1]) >> 8);
86
87 nvkm_kmap(pgd);
88 nvkm_wo32(pgd, (index * 8) + 0, pde[0]);
89 nvkm_wo32(pgd, (index * 8) + 4, pde[1]);
90 nvkm_done(pgd);
91}
92
93static inline u64
94gf100_vm_addr(struct nvkm_vma *vma, u64 phys, u32 memtype, u32 target)
95{
96 phys >>= 8;
97
98 phys |= 0x00000001; /* present */
99 if (vma->access & NV_MEM_ACCESS_SYS)
100 phys |= 0x00000002;
101
102 phys |= ((u64)target << 32);
103 phys |= ((u64)memtype << 36);
104 return phys;
105}
106
107static void
108gf100_vm_map(struct nvkm_vma *vma, struct nvkm_memory *pgt,
109 struct nvkm_mem *mem, u32 pte, u32 cnt, u64 phys, u64 delta)
110{
111 u64 next = 1 << (vma->node->type - 8);
112
113 phys = gf100_vm_addr(vma, phys, mem->memtype, 0);
114 pte <<= 3;
115
116 if (mem->tag) {
117 struct nvkm_ltc *ltc = vma->vm->mmu->subdev.device->ltc;
118 u32 tag = mem->tag->offset + (delta >> 17);
119 phys |= (u64)tag << (32 + 12);
120 next |= (u64)1 << (32 + 12);
121 nvkm_ltc_tags_clear(ltc, tag, cnt);
122 }
123
124 nvkm_kmap(pgt);
125 while (cnt--) {
126 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 0, lower_32_bits(phys));
127 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 4, upper_32_bits(phys));
128 phys += next;
129 pte += 8;
130 }
131 nvkm_done(pgt);
132}
133
134static void
135gf100_vm_map_sg(struct nvkm_vma *vma, struct nvkm_memory *pgt,
136 struct nvkm_mem *mem, u32 pte, u32 cnt, dma_addr_t *list)
137{
138 u32 target = (vma->access & NV_MEM_ACCESS_NOSNOOP) ? 7 : 5;
139 /* compressed storage types are invalid for system memory */
140 u32 memtype = gf100_pte_storage_type_map[mem->memtype & 0xff];
141
142 nvkm_kmap(pgt);
143 pte <<= 3;
144 while (cnt--) {
145 u64 phys = gf100_vm_addr(vma, *list++, memtype, target);
146 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 0, lower_32_bits(phys));
147 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 4, upper_32_bits(phys));
148 pte += 8;
149 }
150 nvkm_done(pgt);
151}
152
153static void
154gf100_vm_unmap(struct nvkm_vma *vma, struct nvkm_memory *pgt, u32 pte, u32 cnt)
155{
156 nvkm_kmap(pgt);
157 pte <<= 3;
158 while (cnt--) {
159 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 0, 0x00000000);
160 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte + 4, 0x00000000);
161 pte += 8;
162 }
163 nvkm_done(pgt);
164}
165
166static void
167gf100_vm_flush(struct nvkm_vm *vm)
168{
169 struct nvkm_mmu *mmu = vm->mmu;
170 struct nvkm_device *device = mmu->subdev.device;
171 struct nvkm_vm_pgd *vpgd;
172 u32 type;
173
174 type = 0x00000001; /* PAGE_ALL */
175 if (atomic_read(&vm->engref[NVKM_SUBDEV_BAR]))
176 type |= 0x00000004; /* HUB_ONLY */
177
178 mutex_lock(&mmu->subdev.mutex);
179 list_for_each_entry(vpgd, &vm->pgd_list, head) {
180 /* looks like maybe a "free flush slots" counter, the
181 * faster you write to 0x100cbc to more it decreases
182 */
183 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
184 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x100c80) & 0x00ff0000)
185 break;
186 );
187
188 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100cb8, vpgd->obj->addr >> 8);
189 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100cbc, 0x80000000 | type);
190
191 /* wait for flush to be queued? */
192 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
193 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x100c80) & 0x00008000)
194 break;
195 );
196 }
197 mutex_unlock(&mmu->subdev.mutex);
198}
199
200static int
201gf100_vm_create(struct nvkm_mmu *mmu, u64 offset, u64 length, u64 mm_offset,
202 struct lock_class_key *key, struct nvkm_vm **pvm)
203{
204 return nvkm_vm_create(mmu, offset, length, mm_offset, 4096, key, pvm);
205}
206
207static const struct nvkm_mmu_func
208gf100_mmu = {
209 .limit = (1ULL << 40),
210 .dma_bits = 40,
211 .pgt_bits = 27 - 12,
212 .spg_shift = 12,
213 .lpg_shift = 17,
214 .create = gf100_vm_create,
215 .map_pgt = gf100_vm_map_pgt,
216 .map = gf100_vm_map,
217 .map_sg = gf100_vm_map_sg,
218 .unmap = gf100_vm_unmap,
219 .flush = gf100_vm_flush,
220};
221
222int
223gf100_mmu_new(struct nvkm_device *device, int index, struct nvkm_mmu **pmmu)
224{
225 return nvkm_mmu_new_(&gf100_mmu, device, index, pmmu);
226}
